answers.answer: I was 24 when diagnosed.  What do his BS's run?  What is his A1c?  Most likely his BS is high.  That means his body is not getting the nutrition it requires.  When his blood sugars remain closer to normal, he will not feel starved all the time.
He doesn't share alot about his levels.  I suspect what you say is right, and will continue to try to talk to him.  Thank you for responding to me.

question: I don't understand how after 26 years, my son can have type one diabetes.  He goes to the doctor, take daily injections, but he is always so hungry.  He lives with us, and really, he eats for a family!  And he still is relatively thin. He is almost 6'5", and weighs about 190.  I worry, and there must be something he can do, to feel satisfied.  Can anyone suggest something?
title: adult son diagnosed with type 1
